text: Patsy Cline (born Virginia Patterson Hensley; September 8, 1932 â€“ March 5, 1963) was an American country music singer. Some of Cline's greatest known hits were "She's Got You," "I Fall to Pieces," "Walkin' After Midnight," "Sweet Dreams," and "Crazy". In 1973, Cline was named to the Country Music Hall of Fame. This was after she had died. She was the first woman to enter the Country Music Hall of Fame. She died on March 5, 1963 in a plane crash near Camden, Tennessee. She is buried at Shenandoah Memorial Park in Winchester, Virginia. ==Related pages== * List of country musicians from Virginia ==References== Category:1932 births Category:1963 deaths Category:20th-century American composers Category:20th-century American singers Category:American country singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Aviation deaths in the United States Category:Contraltos Category:Country musicians from Virginia Category:Singers from Virginia
title: Patsy Cline
